intro: Aquilegia thalictrifolia, commonly known as the thalictrifolia columbine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately compound, with five to seven leaflets that are deeply lobed. The species is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
